title: How Many Calories in a Bowl of Rice?
meta_description: Learn how many calories in a bowl of rice (about 260 kcal for 200g cooked white rice), plus carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition tweaks for different varieties.
h1: How Many Calories in a Bowl of Rice?
assumptions: Plain cooked white rice (long-grain), approximately 200 g per bowl (standard serving, boiled without added fat or salt).
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by rice type, cooking method, portion size, and additions like oil or seasonings. Check labels or use a tracker for precision.

quick_answer.text: A typical bowl of cooked white rice (200 g) contains about 260 kcal, primarily from carbs.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bowl of brown rice?
faqs.a: About 222 kcal for 200 g cooked brown rice, with more fiber than white.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a bowl of rice?
faqs.a: Around 56 g carbs per 200 g bowl of cooked white rice, mostly starch.

faqs.q: Is a bowl of rice high in protein?
faqs.a: No, only about 5 g protein per 200 g; pair with other foods for balance.

faqs.q: How does cooking method affect calories in rice?
faqs.a: Boiled is lowest; frying or adding oil can add 40+ kcal per teaspoon.

faqs.q: What's the serving size for a bowl of rice?
faqs.a: Typically 200 g cooked (1 cup), but varies; measure for accuracy.
